H0.text: Meter stick and spring scale are the tools needed to measure the effects of friction on a block of wood.

H1.text: Balance and stopwatch are the tools needed to measure the effects of friction on a block of wood.

H2.text: Balance and meter stick are the tools needed to measure the effects of friction on a block of wood.

H3.text: A meter stick and a stopwatch are needed to measure the effects of friction on a block of wood.

A4.text: A spring balance measures the weight of an object by opposing the force of gravity acting with the force of an extended spring.

A5.text: A spring balance is a type of mechanical force gauge or weighing scale.

A6.text: A stopwatch is a timepiece designed to measure the amount of time that elapses between its activation and deactivation.

A7.text: NIST Recommended Practice Guide provides stopwatch and timer calibrations

A8.text: Open Source Physics provides a stopwatch computer model
